channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-2733] Failed to retrieve RMIServer stub: javax.naming.NameNotFoundException when trying to connect to ssh container
item.description:
After restarting fabric (in the same Linux terminal window), the JMX connection to the 3rd ssh container fails(all containers run on the same host where fabric is started).
The JMX url is aquired using container-info command.
JMX connection fails both via jconsole and java client. (The java client from https://issues.jboss.org/browse/ENTESB-1611 can be used).
The java client throws exception:

java.io.IOException: Failed to retrieve RMIServer stub: javax.naming.NameNotFoundException: karaf-broker-nossl-b-c2
 
	at javax.management.remote.rmi.RMIConnector.connect(RMIConnector.java:369)
 
	at javax.management.remote.JMXConnectorFactory.connect(JMXConnectorFactory.java:268)
 
	at SimpleJMX.main(SimpleJMX.java:42)
 
Caused by: javax.naming.NameNotFoundException: karaf-broker-nossl-b-c2
 
	at com.sun.jndi.rmi.registry.RegistryContext.lookup(RegistryContext.java:116)
 
	at com.sun.jndi.toolkit.url.GenericURLContext.lookup(GenericURLContext.java:203)
 
	at javax.naming.InitialContext.lookup(InitialContext.java:411)
 
	at javax.management.remote.rmi.RMIConnector.findRMIServerJNDI(RMIConnector.java:1936)
 
	at javax.management.remote.rmi.RMIConnector.findRMIServer(RMIConnector.java:1903)
 
	at javax.management.remote.rmi.RMIConnector.connect(RMIConnector.java:286)
 
	... 2 more

JMX url for karaf-broker-nossl-b-c2:

service:jmx:rmi://vpn1-51-195.bne.redhat.com:44447/jndi/rmi://vpn1-51-195.bne.redhat.com:1102/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c2

Among open ports for process corresponding to karaf-broker-nossl-b-c2 there is no port 44447.

[emedvede@dhcp-4-224 jboss-fuse-6.2.0.redhat-066]$ ss -lntp| grep 15568
 
LISTEN     0      50                       :::8104                    :::*      users:(("java",15568,296))
 
LISTEN     0      50                       :::1102                    :::*      users:(("java",15568,293))
 
LISTEN     0      1          ::ffff:127.0.0.1:42542                   :::*      users:(("java",15568,274))
 
LISTEN     0      50                       :::52759                   :::*      users:(("java",15568,92))
 
LISTEN     0      1          ::ffff:127.0.0.1:38039                   :::*      users:(("java",15568,43))
 
LISTEN     0      50                       :::8184                    :::*      users:(("java",15568,127))

For another container, for which jmx works, the corresponding port 44446 was opened.
item.summary: Failed to retrieve RMIServer stub: javax.naming.NameNotFoundException when trying to connect to ssh container

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The file containers/broker-nossl-a-c2/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-079/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg incorrect serviceUrl (In this serviceUrl the values for ports are taken from previously created container)

#
 
# Port number for RMI registry connection
 
#
 
rmiRegistryPort = 1102
 
 
 
#
 
# Host for RMI registry
 
#
 
rmiRegistryHost = 0.0.0.0
 
 
 
#
 
# Port number for RMI server connection
 
#
 
rmiServerPort = 44447
 
 
 
#
 
# Host for RMI server
 
#
 
rmiServerHost = 0.0.0.0
 
 
 
#
 
# Name of the JAAS realm used for authentication
 
#
 
jmxRealm = karaf
 
 
 
#
 
# The service URL for the JMXConnectorServer
 
#
 
serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44446/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1101/karaf-broker-nossl-a-c2

Changing serviceUrl to service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44447/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1102/karaf-broker-nossl-a-c2 solved the problem.

I confirm. here's the diff between 2nd and 3rd container's etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg files (I don't think it's related to the fact that the fabric was recreated, probably race condition somewhere):

$ diff -u org.apache.karaf.management.cfg /home/grzgrz/containers/broker-nossl-b-c2/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-093/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg  
--- org.apache.karaf.management.cfg	2015-03-19 10:19:06.842679823 +0100
 
+++ /home/grzgrz/containers/broker-nossl-b-c2/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-093/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg	2015-03-19 10:20:15.935417556 +0100
 
@@ -24,7 +24,7 @@
 
 #
 
 # Port number for RMI registry connection
 
 #
 
-rmiRegistryPort = 1101
 
+rmiRegistryPort = 1102
 
 
 #
 
 # Host for RMI registry
 
@@ -34,7 +34,7 @@
 
 #
 
 # Port number for RMI server connection
 
 #
 
-rmiServerPort = 44446
 
+rmiServerPort = 44447
 
 
 #
 
 # Host for RMI server
 
@@ -49,7 +49,7 @@
 
 #
 
 # The service URL for the JMXConnectorServer
 
 #
 
-serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44446/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1101/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c1
 
+serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44446/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1101/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c2
 
 
 #
 
 # Whether any threads started for the JMXConnectorServer should be started as daemon threads
 
@@ -64,4 +64,4 @@
 
 #
 
 # The ObjectName used to register the JMXConnectorServer
 
 #
 
-objectName = connector:name=rmi
 
\ No newline at end of file
 
+objectName = connector:name=rmi

rmiRegistryPort and rmiServerPort are fine. serviceUrl is wrong.
Resolved here. There should be no more discrepancies between rmiServerPort/rmiRegistryPort and serviceUrl in etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg

Elena Medvedeva, hmm, the idea of my fix was to leave:

serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://${rmiServerHost}:${rmiServerPort}/jndi/rmi://${rmiRegistryHost}:${rmiRegistryPort}/karaf-${karaf.name}

without changes, so it's always resolved using the above properties.
I've tried creating single SSH container, and the serviceURL (even after several restarts) is still containing placeholders.
Can you check the file in FUSE/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config? (bundle6 is usually a config admin bundle and data is the place where configurations are stored).

Are you really, really, really sure you're using version 101?

Grzegorz,
I am really using 101
The evidence is here: karaf.management_pic.png in container broker-nossl-c2.
But for other containers which I created earlier in the test (broker-nossl-c0 and broker-nossl-c1), serviceUrl uses placeholders, like in you previous post (see karaf_mamanment_c0.png).

So, I've attached all containers logs: container-log-101.zip and fuse.log (root container): fuse-101.log.

I don't see bundle6 in my FUSE/data/cache folder.

ok - I've reproduced it:

$ grep --include='*management*' -r serviceUrl
 
broker-nossl-b-c3/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c3
 
broker-nossl-b-c3/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c3"
 
broker-nossl-b-c/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c
 
broker-nossl-b-c/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c"
 
broker-nossl-b-c2/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://${rmiServerHost}:${rmiServerPort}/jndi/rmi://${rmiRegistryHost}:${rmiRegistryPort}/karaf-${karaf.name}
 
broker-nossl-b-c2/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c2"

I've created three containers at the same time:

JBossFuse:karaf@root> container-create-ssh --user USER --host 127.0.0.1 --profile mq-broker-a.broker-nossl-b --password PWD broker-nossl-b-c 3
 
The following containers have been created successfully:
 
	Container: broker-nossl-b-c2.
 
	Container: broker-nossl-b-c3.
 
	Container: broker-nossl-b-c.

But the ports configured in ZK are wrong:

JBossFuse:karaf@root> zk:get /fabric/registry/ports/ip/everfree.forest
 
 1099 44444 8101 8181 61617 1100 44445 8102 8182 1101 44446 8103 8183
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root> zk:get /fabric/registry/ports/containers/root/org.apache.karaf.management/rmiRegistryPort
 
1099
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root> zk:get /fabric/registry/ports/containers/broker-nossl-b-c/org.apache.karaf.management/rmiRegistryPort
 
1101
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root> zk:get /fabric/registry/ports/containers/broker-nossl-b-c2/org.apache.karaf.management/rmiRegistryPort
 
1100
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root> zk:get /fabric/registry/ports/containers/broker-nossl-b-c3/org.apache.karaf.management/rmiRegistryPort
 
1100

I think I got it - it looks like it's the same race condition like in FABRIC-1078. When we update configadmin configuration, but first we setBundleLocation(null), we may end up writing old values to configadmin!.

It's better, but still there's problem
At least I got to the point, where rmiRegistryPort, rmiServerPort and serviceUrl are consistent within single container.
I've created 5 SSH container on the same host:

JBossFuse:karaf@root> container-list
 
[id]               [version]  [type]  [connected]  [profiles]                  [provision status]
 
broker-nossl-b-c   1.0        karaf   yes          mq-broker-a.broker-nossl-b  success           
broker-nossl-b-c2  1.0        karaf   yes          mq-broker-a.broker-nossl-b  success           
broker-nossl-b-c3  1.0        karaf   yes          mq-broker-a.broker-nossl-b  success           
broker-nossl-b-c4  1.0        karaf   yes          mq-broker-a.broker-nossl-b  success           
broker-nossl-b-c5  1.0        karaf   yes          mq-broker-a.broker-nossl-b  success           
root*              1.0        karaf   yes          fabric                      success           
                                                   fabric-ensemble-0000-1                        
                                                   jboss-fuse-full

and initially I got this:

$ grep --include='*management.cfg' -r serviceUrl
 
broker-nossl-b-c5/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://${rmiServerHost}:${rmiServerPort}/jndi/rmi://${rmiRegistryHost}:${rmiRegistryPort}/karaf-${karaf.name}
 
broker-nossl-b-c3/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://${rmiServerHost}:${rmiServerPort}/jndi/rmi://${rmiRegistryHost}:${rmiRegistryPort}/karaf-${karaf.name}
 
broker-nossl-b-c/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://${rmiServerHost}:${rmiServerPort}/jndi/rmi://${rmiRegistryHost}:${rmiRegistryPort}/karaf-${karaf.name}
 
broker-nossl-b-c4/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://${rmiServerHost}:${rmiServerPort}/jndi/rmi://${rmiRegistryHost}:${rmiRegistryPort}/karaf-${karaf.name}
 
broker-nossl-b-c2/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://${rmiServerHost}:${rmiServerPort}/jndi/rmi://${rmiRegistryHost}:${rmiRegistryPort}/karaf-${karaf.name}
 
[grzgrz@everfree] ~/containers 
$ grep --include='*management.config' -r serviceUrl
 
broker-nossl-b-c5/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c5"
 
broker-nossl-b-c3/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c3"
 
broker-nossl-b-c/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c"
 
broker-nossl-b-c4/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c4"
 
broker-nossl-b-c2/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c2"

so totally wrong - SSH container creating scripts detected the same rmi/server ports as free. But don't worry - KarafContainerRegistration should consult ZK and choose free ports.

So after all settled down:

$ grep --include='*management.cfg' -r serviceUrl
 
broker-nossl-b-c5/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44448/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1102/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c5
 
broker-nossl-b-c3/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://${rmiServerHost}:${rmiServerPort}/jndi/rmi://${rmiRegistryHost}:${rmiRegistryPort}/karaf-${karaf.name}
 
broker-nossl-b-c/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://${rmiServerHost}:${rmiServerPort}/jndi/rmi://${rmiRegistryHost}:${rmiRegistryPort}/karaf-${karaf.name}
 
broker-nossl-b-c4/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44447/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1101/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c4
 
broker-nossl-b-c2/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44446/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c2
 
[grzgrz@everfree] ~/containers 
$ grep --include='*management.config' -r serviceUrl
 
broker-nossl-b-c5/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44448/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1102/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c5"
 
broker-nossl-b-c3/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c3"
 
broker-nossl-b-c/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c"
 
broker-nossl-b-c4/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44447/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1101/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c4"
 
broker-nossl-b-c2/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44446/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c2"

Almost good, but we have two ports 44445 and three ports 1100. So it must be something with ZK synchronization.
That's why I'm adding Paolo Antinori, Guillaume Nodet and Ioannis Canellos to check if you know where might be a problem. I see Paolo that you've changed ZK/curator synchronization primitives in FABRIC-1185.

Will work on this issue on Monday.

Thanks to Paolo Antinori and changed curator recipe, I've exposed the synchronization primitive and it finally works:

[grzgrz@everfree] ~/containers 
$ grep --include='*management.config' -r serviceUrl|sort
 
broker-nossl-b-c2/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44445/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1100/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c2"
 
broker-nossl-b-c3/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44449/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1104/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c3"
 
broker-nossl-b-c4/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44446/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1101/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c4"
 
broker-nossl-b-c5/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44448/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1103/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c5"
 
broker-nossl-b-c6/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44447/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1102/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c6"
 
broker-nossl-b-c/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/data/cache/bundle6/data/config/org/apache/karaf/management.config:serviceUrl="service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44450/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1105/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c"
 
[grzgrz@everfree] ~/containers 
$ grep --include='*management.cfg' -r serviceUrl|sort
 
broker-nossl-b-c2/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://${rmiServerHost}:${rmiServerPort}/jndi/rmi://${rmiRegistryHost}:${rmiRegistryPort}/karaf-${karaf.name}
 
broker-nossl-b-c3/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44449/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1104/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c3
 
broker-nossl-b-c4/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44446/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1101/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c4
 
broker-nossl-b-c5/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44448/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1103/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c5
 
broker-nossl-b-c6/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44447/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1102/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c6
 
broker-nossl-b-c/fabric8-karaf-1.2.0.redhat-101/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg:serviceUrl = service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44450/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1105/karaf-broker-nossl-b-c

The first list is from Config Admin data itself and the second is a grep from etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg - broker-nossl-b-c2 doesn't contain expanded serviceUrl property because when KarafContainerRegistration was initializing, it didn't have to change the ports found by shell script creating SSH container.
Fix and test ready here. Finally the ports should be allocated without conflicts between containers on the same host.
Verified on jboss-fuse-6.2.0.redhat-102, the issue is fixed.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. start ssh server
2. Start Fuse and create fabric, and wait for provision.
3. Run commands:

mq-create --no-ssl --parent-profile=mq-replicated --group a broker-nossl-b
 
 
 
profile-edit --system org.apache.activemq.leveldb.test=true mq-broker-a.broker-nossl-b
 
 
 
fabric:container-create-ssh --user USER --host 127.0.0.1  --profile mq-broker-a.broker-nossl-b --password PASSWORD broker-nossl-b-c0
 
 
 
fabric:container-create-ssh --user USER --host 127.0.0.1  --profile mq-broker-a.broker-nossl-b --password PASSWORD broker-nossl-b-c1
 
 
 
fabric:container-create-ssh --user USER --host 127.0.0.1  --profile mq-broker-a.broker-nossl-b --password PASSWORD broker-nossl-b-c2

4. Wait for all containers to start successfully (check with 'container-list') command

5. For each ssh containers run command 

container-info broker-nossl-b-c0
 
container-info broker-nossl-b-c1
 
container-info broker-nossl-b-c2

and try to connect to jmx using JMX url provided. It connects successfully.

6. stop fuse
7. kill all container processes

pkill -f karaf

and check that there are no more karaf processes

ps aux| grep karaf

8. Delete fuse/data and fuse/instances folders
9. Delete HOME/containers folder
10. In the same Linux terminal repeat steps 2-5.
The connection to the last container karaf-broker-nossl-b-c2 fails. It seems to work the same way if instead amq containers use containers with other profiles.
